byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP, MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: Decline in security at Clinton Correctional Facility, long considered one of most secure prisons in nation, likely set stage for escape and manhunt that continues more than two weeks later; no single lapse is cited, but oversights and lax standards had mounted in years preceding escape, making it easier for men to carry out plan; search for Matt W Richard and David P Sweat takes new turn with possible sighting 350 miles southwest of prison.
lead_paragraph: The Clinton Correctional Facility had in recent years left some security posts unfilled and seen lapses in routine security procedures, current and former officials say.

headline.main: Lapses at Prison May Have Aided Killers’ Escape
